Name: Omniscien Technologies Language Studio
Price: Depends on configuration and capacity. Different prices for cloud vs on-premise and scale/volumes.
Notes: Hybrid neural machine translation, hybrid deep neural machine translation, syntax-based, rules-based and statistical machine translation. Provides a server platform and a set of desktop tools to aid in translation. Omnscien also offers Machine learning, data cleaning and language processing tools.

Name: Apertium
Platform: Cross-platform (Web application), Unix compatible Precompiled packages available for Debian
column8: all programs and language data are free and open source

Name: Anusaaraka
Notes: Rule-based, deep parser based, paninian framework based
column8: all programs and language data are free and open-source

Name: IBM
Notes: Both rule-based and statistical models developed by IBM Research. Neural Machine Translation models available through the Watson Language Translator API for developers.[1][2]

Name: Moses
Notes: Drop-in replacement for Pharaoh, features factored translation models and decoding of confusion networks.

Name: NiuTrans
Notes: Competitive performance for Chinese translation tasks
column8: statistical machine translation. Supports phrase-based, hierarchical phrase-based, and syntax-based (string-to-tree, tree-to-string, and tree-to-tree) models for research purposes.

Name: Bing Translator
Notes: Microsoft's linguistically informed statistical MT system

Name: SAIC Omnifluent
Notes: Hybrid machine translation combines rule-based machine translation and statistical machine translation, integrated with automatic speech recognition on a single platform that translates text and audio files.[4][5]

Name: Slate Rocks
Notes: Applications with complete SMT stack run on Windows, Linux and MacOS to build Moses SMT models and integrate with CAT tools.

Name: SDL Machine Translation
Notes: Neural and Statistical based Machine Translation

Name: Babylon
Price: Depends on license ($9.90–$89 for one license)
Notes: Prompts to install the Babylon Toolbar, a browser hijacker which is difficult to remove.[6][7]
